Description: Ostracon, two fragments (now joined) of the body of a grey-brown pottery vessel, slightly ribbed, the interior is covered with a black deposit, the exterior is covered with a slip and very faint traces of at least six lines of Coptic text written in black ink, the whole is very discoloured, containing an account of supplies.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.117-118)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87622) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87622)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 132 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
